name: HDR
body:
### Genesis Framework
Wordpress Frameworks extend core WordPress functionalities by exposing and then enhancing specific functionalities beyond their native purpose to create a specific type of theme usually for specific types of user. This type of development requires a parent and child theme relationship. We would develop the parent theme using the framework for functionality and create "skin" child themes with CSS styles for design/modification.

Pros | Cons
------------ | -------------
Framework + Starter Theme | Added cost $59.95
Themes can be used multiple times for clients |  Framework needs to be updated upon new versions
Mobile responsive |  Learning curve - takes time to learn
Multi-language |  Dependent on parent/child theme relationship
Customizations won’t disappear (one-click software upgrade) | Wordpress needs to be updated
Speeds up development |  
Mobile responsive |  
Code library / extended functionalities |  
Support |  
SEO |  


### HTML5 Blank Wordpress Boilerplate Theme 
Webs most popular front-end framework. HTML5 Boilerplate helps you build fast, robust, and adaptable web apps or sites. As the fifth revision of the HTML standard, HTML5 aims to improve the language by providing support for the latest multimedia while remaining a user-friendly language. Some of the new features found in HTML5 include:

• New syntactic features, including video, audio and canvas elements
• Integrated scalable vector graphics content
• MathML for mathematical formulas

These features make it easier to include multimedia and graphical content without needing to use plugins and APIs. Meanwhile, HTML5 WordPress templates aim to take full advantage of the new functionality of the updated version of the HTML language. 

Pros | Cons
------------ | -------------
Open source | Wordpress needs to be updated
Themes can be used multiple times for clients |  Rename files to avoid overwrite by upgrades
Mobile responsive |  
Speeds up development |   
Pre-loaded with core features for quicker build |  
GitHub / Community Support |  
SEO | 

### Redux (advanced theme options panel)
Has all the code included to build out a full featured options panel. We build the options directly into the theme as a base that could be used across all our themes. Offers other advanced templating features.

Pros | Cons
------------ | -------------
Easy to use for customers | Wordpress needs to be updated
Used across all themes for modification |  Framework needs to be updated upon new versions
Completely Brandable |  
Cross-Browser Compatible |   
Limitless Flexibility / Validations |  
Open source |  
Clean code for customization |  
Support |
